tool.name: MergeCleanup

param.name: SEG_ID
param.dialogReference: Segment ID, disabled from user input. Inherited from Segment 1 (GUID1). In other words, the SEG_ID of the "merged to" segment.

param.name: PRIME_NAME
param.dialogReference: PRIME_NAME, disabled from user input. Inherited from Segment 1 (GUID1). In other words, the PRIME_NAME of the "merged to" segment.

param.name: ADDR_L_FR
param.dialogReference: Address left from. The address ranges are inherited values from GUID1. This means that the user must alter these values for correct address ranges.

param.name: ADDR_L_TO
param.dialogReference: Address left to. The address ranges are inherited values from GUID1. This means that the user must alter these values for correct address ranges.

param.name: ADDR_R_FR
param.dialogReference: Address right from. The address ranges are inherited values from GUID1. This means that the user must alter these values for correct address ranges.

param.name: ADDR_R_TO
param.dialogReference: Address right to. The address ranges are inherited values from GUID1. This means that the user must alter these values for correct address ranges.

param.name: ZIPCODE_L
param.dialogReference: Zipcode on the left side of the road. Example; 07753

param.name: ZIPCODE_R
param.dialogReference: Zipcode on the right side of the road. Example; 07753

param.name: ZIPNAME_L
param.dialogReference: Zipcode name on the left side of the road. Example; 'Neptune'

param.name: ZIPNAME_R
param.dialogReference: Zipcode name on the right side of the road. Example; 'Neptune'

param.name: MUNI_ID_L
param.dialogReference: Municipal ID on the left side of the road. Example; 882111

param.name: MUNI_ID_R
param.dialogReference: Municipal ID on the right side of the road. Example; 882111

param.name: ELEV_TYPE_ID_FR
param.dialogReference: Elevation type ID from.

param.name: ELEV_TYPE_ID_TO
param.dialogReference: Elevation type ID to.

param.name: ACC_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Access type

param.name: SURF_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Surface type

param.name: STATUS_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Status type.

param.name: SYMBOL_TYPE_ID
param.expression: Highway Authority Route | Highway Authority Ramp | Interstate | Insterstate Ramp | US Highway | US Highway Ramp | State Highway | State Highway Ramp | County 500 Route | County 500 Ramp | Other County Route | Other County Ramp | Local Road | Local Ramp | Alley
param.dialogReference: Symbol type.

param.name: TRAVEL_DIR_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Travel direction type

param.name: JURIS_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference: Jurisdiction type. This can be one of; Public, Private, or Unkown.

param.name: OIT_REV_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference:
NJ Office of Information Technology (OIT) review type.

If the user is on the OIT domain, this will automatically populate as 'Final', otherwise it will default to 'Draft'

param.name: DOT_REV_TYPE_ID
param.dialogReference:
NJ Department of Transportation (DOT) review type.

If the user is on the DOT domain, this will automatically populate as 'Final', otherwise it will default to 'Draft'

param.name: update milepost
param.displayname: Update LINEAR_REF MILEPOST_FR and MILEPOST_TO values (if applicable)
param.dialogReference:
If there are records in LINEAR_REF for this road segment, the MILEPOST fields will need to be updated.

If the box is checked, the FR and TO values for each segment GUID2 will be interpolated using the M-values from the newly merged segment. This handles LRS_TYPE 1 (NJDOT Multi-Centerline), 2 (NJDOT Parent), and 3 (NJDOT Flipped). However, it does not hande LRS_TYPE 4 (MMS Milepost Markers) becasue this is not directly based on M-values from SEGMENT. NJ OGIS is planning support for this in new releases of the NJ Road Editor Python Add-In.

If the box is unchecked, the values from the original segment (GUID1) will persist.

tool.summary:
The NJ Road Editor Merge tool in cleanup mode is launched in the same way as the standard mode tool, accept the user should choose “Yes” on the dialog box shown in figure A7. After choosing “Yes” the tool dialog box will launch (i.e. this tool) and the fields should be filled out in the same way as standard mode.

All of the fields will be automatically populated with the values that are in GUID1 (see the figure below). The user should be aware that the address ranges are not interpolated, like in the Split tool, but this functionality will be added in later releases. Cleanup mode was designed to merge small insignificant or erronous segments into a larger segment without having to go through SEGMENT_CHANGE, SEGMENT_TRANS, or assigning a new SEG_GUID. Instead, GUID0 is simply added to GUID1 and all remnant of GUID0 are deleted from the database. If there are M-values from GUID0 that were added to GUID1, they will be updated in the LINEAR_REF MILEPOST values. Like standard mode, MMS Milepost Markers are not handled because they are not linked to M-values, so the user must manually update this field if it needs to be changed. The summary of events that takes place in cleanup mode;

  • SEG_NAME – delete all GUID0 records

  • SEG_SHIELD – delete all GUID0 records.

  • LINEAR_REF – delete all GUID0 records.

  • LINEAR_REF – update all GUID1 records.

  • SEGMENT_COMMENTS – delete all GUID0 records.

  • SEGMENT_CHANGE – nothing happens

  • SEGMENT_TRANS – nothing happens

  • SEG_NAME – delete all GUID0 records

  • SEG_SHIELD – delete all GUID0 records

  • SEGMENT – delete GUID0

  • SEGMENT – update GUID1 with user input

  • SLD_ROUTE – nothing happens.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Author: NJ Office of Information Technology, Office of GIS. Support: njgin@oit.state.nj.us Bugs: email support, subject: "NJ Road Editor Add-In"

Consts.useLimit: This tool is licenced under the GPLv3 license. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses.
